Manifest.Name: Microsoft System Center Service Designer Library

ClassType.Comment: This will contain AD as a Service. We will need to change the this to contain generic Directory Service in the future when we support modeling any Messaging service
For now will contain any Application Component, but in future would be from System.MailStore
This ServiceComponent is for Network Services like DNS, DHCP, etc...
This is the physical network infrastructure
This is not the Mail store, but the logical or physical storage (e.g. a SAN/NAS/JBOD) that hold the mail store
root for all components that will be contained by the System.Service class

RelationshipType.Comment: Base relationship to use when creating new component groups
Web Farm - Web Farm Containment relationships
Web Farm - Web Farm Containment relationships
Web Farm - Web Farm Containment relationships
Web Farm - Web Farm Containment relationships

DisplayString.Name: Service Contains New Component Groups
DisplayString.Description: This relationship is used to control rollup behavior for new compoenent groups of a service.

DisplayString.Name: Distributed Application Dynamic Diagram View
DisplayString.Description: Distributed Application Dynamic Diagram View

DisplayString.Name: Blank
DisplayString.Description: This distributed application is used for general purposes. This template will allow you to start from a blank slate and compose your distributed application from the ground up.

DisplayString.Name: Business Service
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent Business Service in Service Manager space.

DisplayString.Name: Computers Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent ComputersGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Network Devices Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent NetworkDevicesGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Storage Devices Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent StorageDevicesGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Physical Objects Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent PhysicalObjectsGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Application Components Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent ApplicationComponentsGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Website Components Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent WebsiteComponentsGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Database Components Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent DataBaseComponentsGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Other Components Group
DisplayString.Description: This class is used to represent OtherComponentsGroup.

DisplayString.Name: Blank Distributed Application Health Roll-up
DisplayString.Description: This monitor rolls up health from all component groups defined by the user.

DisplayString.Name: Distributed Application Designer Library
DisplayString.Description: System Center Distributed Application Designer Library: Contains the various Distributed Application Types that show up in the Distributed Application Designer

DisplayString.Name: Messaging
DisplayString.Description: This distributed application contains various components that are common to Messaging Services.

DisplayString.Name: Directory Services
DisplayString.Description: This contains the components of a Directory Service like Active Directory.

DisplayString.Name: Directory Component Health Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Directory Services Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Directory Services Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Clients
DisplayString.Description: This contains a set of Client perspectives that emulate Messaging client behavior to excerise the health of the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Clients Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Clients Group Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Messaging Clients Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Components
DisplayString.Description: This contains a set of components like Exchange mailstores.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Component Group Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Messaging Component Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Messaging Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Network Services
DisplayString.Description: This contains Network Services like DNS.

DisplayString.Name: Network Component Group Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Network Component Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Network Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Physical Network Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This contains the physical network devices that connect the Messaging Infrastructure.

DisplayString.Name: Physical Network Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Physical Network Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: Storage
DisplayString.Description: This contains a set of objects that store all data for Messaging. This may directly contain physical disks or logical disks.

DisplayString.Name: Storage Group Rollup
DisplayString.Description: Rolls up health from the Storage Group Component Group to the Messaging Distributed Application.

DisplayString.Name: User Created Distributed Application
DisplayString.Description: All distributed applications edited or created with the Distributed Application Designer inherit from this class.

DisplayString.Name: Distributed Application Component
DisplayString.Description: All component groups edited or created with the Distributed Application Designer inherit from this class.

DisplayString.Name: Line of Business Web Application
DisplayString.Description: This distributed application contains Web Sites and Databases.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Databases
DisplayString.Description: This contains a set of databases that belong to a user defined distributed application.

DisplayString.Name: Databases Component Group Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This monitor rolls up health of the Database component group.

DisplayString.Name: Web Application Web Sites
DisplayString.Description: This contains a set of web sites that belong to a user defined distributed application.

DisplayString.Name: Web Site Component Group Health Rollup
DisplayString.Description: This monitor rolls up health of the members into the group state.

DisplayString.Description: Service ID

DisplayString.Name: Contains Database
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a database group and the databases that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Computer Role
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a directory service group and the computer roles that it contains

DisplayString.Name: References Network Services
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a directory service and the network services that it references

DisplayString.Name: References Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a directory service and the physical network that it references

DisplayString.Name: References Messaging Components
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging client and the messaging components that it references

DisplayString.Name: Contains Perspective
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging client group and the perspective that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Mail Store
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging component group and a mail store that it contains

DisplayString.Name: References Directory Services
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging component and the directory services that it references

DisplayString.Name: References Network Services
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging component and the network services that it references

DisplayString.Name: References Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging component and a physical network that it references

DisplayString.Name: References Storage
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging component and storage device

DisplayString.Name: Contains Directory Service
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the directory services that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Messaging Client
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the messaging clients that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Messaging Component
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the messaging components that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Network Service
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the network services that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the physical network that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Storage
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a messaging service and the storage that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Computer Role
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a network services group and a computer role that it contains

DisplayString.Name: References Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a network service and a physical network that it references

DisplayString.Name: Contains Network Device
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a physical network group and the network devices that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Logical Hardware
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a storage group and the logical hardware that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Physical Hardware
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a storage group and the physical hardware that it contains

DisplayString.Name: References Physical Network
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a storage device and a physical network that it references

DisplayString.Name: Contains Database Group
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a Web application and a database group that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Web Site Group
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a Web application and a Web site group that it contains

DisplayString.Name: Contains Web Site
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a Web site group and the Web sites that it contains

DisplayString.Name: References Database
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a Web site and a database that it references

DisplayString.Name: Has Group
DisplayString.Description: Relationship between a service and the groups that it contains

maml:section.maml:title: Purpose:
maml:section.maml:para: The Blank Template gives you an empty distributed application ready for customization.

maml:section.maml:title: Purpose:
maml:section.maml:para: The Messaging Template gives you a starting point for modeling and designing your Messaging Infrastructure.

maml:section.maml:title: Features:
maml:section.maml:para: This Distributed Application Template shows you all the objects of the most common Messaging components such as Exchange mail stores, DNS infrastructure, Active Directory or other Directory Services.

maml:section.maml:title: Purpose:
maml:section.maml:para: The Line of Business Web Application Template gives you a starting point for defining a set of Web Sites and Databases objects that communicate with each other that make up a critical business application.

maml:section.maml:title: Features:
maml:section.maml:para: This Distributed Application Template shows you all the Web Sites and Databases objects that the Management Packs you have imported have discovered. You will get a typical Web Farm Topology.
